div.div: LLS Board Presentation: Response to CoronaVirus

div.h2: Los Lunas Schools: Response to the COVID-19 Virus

ul.li: All CDC and DOH guidelines will be followed.
Charge Nurse will be monitoring CDC and DOH recommendations and will be apprising us of the recommendations.
Mandates will be followed from the DOH, CDC, and PED.
Safe Schools Supplement for COVID-19 Protocols
Superintendent Sanders will disseminate information to staff, students and parents.

h3.span: Current Guidance from CDC and DOH:

ul.li:
PED/DOH Briefings:
March 12 - 9:00 - 11:30 a.m.
March 12 - 5:40 - 6:15 p.m.
March 13 - 10:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m.
March 16 PED Memorandum

a.title: link to Center for Disease Control website
link to New Mexico Department of Health website

ul.li: Schools are closed until April 6th.
Facility usage groups will not utilize our fields and gyms during the next three weeks.
All athletic events and practices are suspended.
Only essential staff will be working during the closure.
Graduation will continue as planned pending future PED direction.
Status of Proms and other large school events will be determined closer to the planned dates.
At this time all travel in state and out of state is canceled.
Athletic Events, Extracurricular Activities, Clubs, Field Trips, Guest Speakers are suspended until at least April 6th.
All outside groups utilizing our facilities are suspended until April 6th.

li.span:
Social Media: Instagram, Facebook
Twitter, District Website
CDC Germ Prevention Posters Posted School Wide (all sites)
After the 24 hours, begin disinfecting the school and buses and then keep it closed for an additional 24 hours.
Affected individuals must remain out of school for 14 days
NMDOH and NMPED will be contacted to discuss the situation and determine if extended closure is warranted
​Governor and NMPED closed school until April 6th.

h3.span: Custodial Staff Procedures for School (Preventative Measures):

li.span: ​All custodians and maintenance employees trained on preventative disinfecting protocols on March 16th at each school site.

Essential staff including custodians and maintenance employees are working during the school closure.
Disinfection of playground equipment and all buses.
CDC Germ Prevention Posters are Posted School Wide.

h3.span: Custodial Staff Procedures for School (possible infection procedures):

ul.li: All custodians and maintenance employees trained on preventative disinfecting protocols on March 16th.
They must refer to Safe Schools Supplement for COVID-19 Protocols.

Starting on Tuesday, March 17th:
Meal sites at LLHS, KGE, Peralta, LLE, DVE, Ann Parish, Meadow Lake Fire Station, Highland Meadows, Huning Park
Weekdays 11:30 - 1:00 (except for Holidays)
Grab and Go drive-thru distribution
Security will be provided by School Resource Officers and other local law enforcement agencies
Online learning considerations
Special Education: Teletherapy
Canvas
Google Classroom
APEX
Current curriculum is available online for staff and students
Family technology survey
